2.text: “How long will you torment me and crush me with your words?

3.text: Ten times now you have reproached me; you shamelessly mistreat me.

4.text: Even if I have truly gone astray, my error concerns me alone.

5.text: If indeed you would exalt yourselves above me and use my disgrace against me,

6.text: then understand that it is God who has wronged me and drawn His net around me.

7.text: Though I cry out, ‘Violence!’ I get no response; though I call for help, there is no justice.

8.text: He has blocked my way so I cannot pass; He has veiled my paths with darkness.

9.text: He has stripped me of my honor and removed the crown from my head.

10.text: He tears me down on every side until I am gone; He uproots my hope like a tree.

11.text: His anger burns against me, and He counts me among His enemies.

12.text: His troops advance together; they construct a ramp against me and encamp around my tent.

13.text: He has removed my brothers from me; my acquaintances have abandoned me.

14.text: My kinsmen have failed me, and my friends have forgotten me.

15.text: My guests and maidservants count me as a stranger; I am a foreigner in their sight.

16.text: I call for my servant, but he does not answer, though I implore him with my own mouth.

17.text: My breath is repulsive to my wife, and I am loathsome to my own family.

18.text: Even little boys scorn me; when I appear, they deride me.

19.text: All my best friends despise me, and those I love have turned against me.

20.text: My skin and flesh cling to my bones; I have escaped by the skin of my teeth.

21.text: Have pity on me, my friends, have pity, for the hand of God has struck me.

22.text: Why do you persecute me as God does? Will you never get enough of my flesh?

23.text: I wish that my words were recorded and inscribed in a book,

24.text: by an iron stylus on lead, or chiseled in stone forever.

25.text: But I know that my Redeemer lives, and in the end He will stand upon the earth.

26.text: Even after my skin has been destroyed, yet in my flesh I will see God.

27.text: I will see Him for myself; my eyes will behold Him, and not as a stranger. How my heart yearns within me!

28.text: If you say, ‘Let us persecute him, since the root of the matter lies with him,’

29.text: then you should fear the sword yourselves, because wrath brings punishment by the sword, so that you may know there is a judgment.”
